title: Norwich City transfer rumours : Christian Fassnacht in talks
body_text:
Young Boys and Swiss international midfielder Christian Fassnacht is closing in on a Norwich City move.
The 29-year-old right sided midfielder, who worked under David Wagner during his spell in Swiss club football, was left out of Young Boys' squad on Sunday for their league opener.
Young Boys offically confirmed prior to kick-off Fassnacht had been released from the squad, to conduct contract talks with an overseas club.
Christian Fassnacht figuriert heute nicht im Aufgebot des BSC YB, er wurde von der Clubleitung für Vertragsgespräche im Ausland freigestellt.#BSCYB pic.twitter.com/3JfWWfx74y
— BSC YOUNG BOYS (@BSC_YB) July 23, 2023
Bern-based newspaper, Derbund, reported after YB's opener, Fassnacht had indicated to team mates on Saturday he was Norwich-bound, before heading to England to complete discussions and undergo a medical.
They also carried a quote attributed to sporting director Steve von Bergen, ahead of a deal likely to be finalised on Monday, "It suits us, it fits for Fassnacht."
City are believed to be actively working on potential deals and Wagner himself reiterated after the midweek friendly against AZ in the Netherlands he expected more 'ins and outs' before the conclusion of the window.
The Zurich-born midfielder, who had 21 goal contributions in 34 appearances last season in YB's romp to the Swiss Super League title, is also attracting interest from Turkey and Germany.
Swiss football outlet, KMedia also posted on Sunday Norwich are believed to be in pole position.
Von Bergen told Swiss media ahead of the opening weekend of league fixtures YB would like to keep Fassnacht beyond the final 12 months of his current deal, but the clock was ticking.
"Christian is an enormously important player, he knows about our desire to extend with him," he said. "He has to find out what he wants, but it's not like we can wait forever.
"We need to know where we stand with him. In life, you always come to the moment when you have to make a decision. The ball is in his court now."
The Swiss have already recruited Inter Milan attacking midfielder Darian Males in recent days.
Fassnacht has 19 international caps and at YB has won the Swiss title five times and the cup twice since arriving from FC Thun in 2017.
In his absence, Young Boys needed a 97th minute winner from the penalty spot to beat Lausanne at home to get their Swiss Super League title defence underway.
Wagner was in charge for the 2021/22 season that saw YB finish third in the domestic league, but beat Manchester United in the Champions League, with Fassnacht playing in that tie.
The City boss has made no secret of his desire to add another addition in attacking areas this summer, after Spanish signing Borja Sainz was ruled out until October with an ankle injury.
City have also been linked with Portuguese winger Rafael Camacho in the last few days.
The Canaries signed Ashley Barnes, Jack Stacey and Shane Duffy in the first part of the transfer window, but have yet to make any further senior additions following the arrival of Sainz.
Norwich are currently on tour in Austria and scheduled to play Toulouse on Tuesday in their penultimate friendly, before travelling back to England for their final tune up against Olympiacos at Carrow Road.
